attributes.action: Install adequate road lighting on the A249 sittingbourne
attributes.background:
Night time driving is never easy,  and unlit roads are a major hazard to all of us using them at night. 
The A249, sittingbourne is a perfect example of this problem.  Something needs to be done before more accidents happen!!!!
attributes.additional_details: From the m20, onto the A249, past Detling Hill through to keycole roundabout, the lighting at night is ridiculously poor & so dangerous to drivers using this stretch of road at night. There is no street lighting & also no cats eyes on the road, and road markings are very worn and near invisable

attributes.action: Implement stronger sentences for those convicted of assaulting police officers
attributes.background: Assaults on police officers have dramatically risen, with officers frequently being attacked in the line of duty. Police officers put their lives on the line protecting citizens every day and the lack of respect that people who attack them show should be reflected through stronger sentences.
attributes.additional_details: I am a serving officer with the Metropolitan Police service and have heard about and witnessed first hand details of assaults on colleagues. Colleagues who whilst on patrol get spat at, bitten, punched, kicked, sometimes repeatedly, violently assaulted. Only today two police officers were admitted to hospital in London after being assaulted challenging a youth who was carrying a knife. Police officers need to be shown respect for serving the population, and this needs to be shown via sentencing

attributes.action: Introduction of Mental Health into National Curriculum and Hospitals
attributes.background:
We truly believe that more needs to be done in relation to suicide.

There should be no stigma attached to Mental Health and the only way to eradicate a stigma surrounding a 'taboo' subject is to educate by bringing it into National Curriculum and more information/care available in hospitals.
attributes.additional_details:
6581 committed suicide in 2014 alone, each and everyone of those people had a family, friends and countless people that would have been touched by their passing.
We passionately believe that the rates of suicide would decrease if Mental Health was part of the National Curriculum and the younger generation were aware of what symptoms to look out for in themselves and those around them
With that we also believe that there's room for improvement with information and Mental Health care in hospitals

attributes.action: Fathers should automatically be granted 50% custody of their children by law
attributes.background: At present a father needs to fight to have 50% access to their child. A child that is legally a mother and fathers. A child needs a father just as much as a mother and the current legislation is not only stuck in the dark ages but favours considerably the mother. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Get idebenone on prescription for patients with LHON
attributes.background: Leber hereditary optic neuropathy (LHON) is an inherited form of vision loss. People with LHON decide to take idebenone to possibly help restore their vision but it costs some over Â£150 a month with no guarantee that it is the actual drug because of ordering tablets off the Internet to get it.

attributes.action: Abolish universal credit and resort back to tried and tested benefits system
attributes.background: An increasing number of customers are suffering severe hardship because of the new system. I myself have been waiting 3 months to be paid. Costs to call the service are ridiculous for those on a low income amd letters are being issued deliberatly encouraging people to waste precious money on calls.
attributes.additional_details: Increasing number of stories and requests for help are being posted online all over the country. Those of us forced onto universal credit are suffering severe hardship and un realistic sanctions aswell as ridiculous call charges to speak to ill informed poorly trained and rude staff who have no idea how to resolve issues with one member of staff admitting that letters requesting information are simply to entice people to call the premium rate telephone number. Restore the benefits system!

attributes.action:
Michaela's Law
Make it law that all council run parks have CCTV in play areas
attributes.background: My 10 yr old daughter was seriously assaulted by a 45 yr old adult in July 2016.There wasn't CCTV and because of this my daughters attacker got away with it.If there had been CCTV my daughter and family wouldn't have had to go through what we are now.The long term psychological impact is devastating
attributes.additional_details: Please support this so that no other family has to go through what we are going through. Children should be safe guarded and protected in this day an age. All children are entitled to play freely and feel safe at all times.

attributes.action: Collate the costs of our Refugee effort and charge it to the Overseas Aid Budget
attributes.background: To collate all costs born within the borders of the United Kingdom relating to the Accommodation; Feeding; Clothing; Medical Care; Education: Translation and Judicial costs of refugees both legal and Illegal.    The sum of these collated costs to be paid from the Overseas Aid Budget.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the costs relating to refugees are being born unfairly by local Councils and thus the Taxpayer.  Similarly, the NHS and local social services are bearing additional costs due to translation and capacity issues.   These refugees have left areas where we already allocate aid, their departure therefore reduces the local requirements, but increase costs in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to dump animals.
attributes.background: Many charities like Animal Aid have to rescue many dumped kittens and puppies on a daily basis because of people just abandoning them on the street in a box. I want it to be illegal to dump animals and for people who do to be never allowed to have pets again.

attributes.action: Change Family Court Orders regarding Parental Alienation.
attributes.background:
Family Court Orders to automatically state

"Neither parent should cause intentional Parental Alienation including Psychology Manipulation & Isolation of Parental Responsibilities"

Parental Alienation has huge effects on children IE: Their education, mental, emotional state & causes anxieties.
attributes.additional_details:
This would exclude: Domestic Violence or if an Injunctions in place

What's Parental Alienation? 
It is the Physiology Manipulation of young children & isolation of a Parents Responsibilities. PR Example: Schooling, Health, Religion, General decisions on bringing up of the child.

Many parents that take their child's legal guardian to court & leave to find they have the same issues.

Adding this to court orders would resolve this PA issue.

More info: parentalalienation.webs.com

attributes.action: Put tackling climate change at the top of the government's agenda.
attributes.background: For too long climate change has been a secondary consideration, yet it is the defining challenge of our time. I call on the government to create a separate department and minister of state for climate change, and to make climate change a central consideration of all future policy-making decisions.
attributes.additional_details:
We must rapidly increase investment in research and technologies to understand climate science, realise new technologies, quickly decarbonise our economy and increase our resillience to future uncertainty. This can wait no longer. We need strong leadership from this government. Even the possibility of accelerating climate change should shock us out of complacency.
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/climate-change-game-over-global-warming-climate-sensitivity-seven-degrees-a7407881.html

attributes.action: Stop the child tax credit cuts for a third child born from 6th April 2017.
attributes.background: This policy would lead to child poverty and charities are concerned that this would result in poverty and generations of lower classes whereby this right is only for the privileged. Those who said we are all in it together can not implement this policy. Thereby we urge the government to review this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/sites/default/files/The%20Childrens%20Society%20-%20two%20child%20limit%20supplementary%20evidence.docx

http://www.barnardos.org.uk/poverty_full_report_07.pdf

attributes.action: Penalties against custodians turning away people accompanied by Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: Access discrimination to become a criminal offence with hefty statuatory fines put in place with further offenses increasing the fines given and lead to liquor, transport, or trading license being revoked
attributes.additional_details:
Across the UK, there are currently over 6,700 disabled and impaired people who have become the recipient of Assistance Dogs, specially trained to help them so that their disability is less of the daily burden it was before.
In 2010 the Government abolished the Disability Discrimination Act 1995, replacing it with the Equality Act 2010. This Act is insufficient in making companies fall in line with such procedures. This must be addressed with penalties put in place for non-compliance.

attributes.action: Stop classifying cats as "property" under UK law
attributes.background: Recently in the U.K. there have been a number of cases of people killing cats, U.K. Law means these people are only charged with damage to property, the law needs changing to reflect reality, that cats are not property but family members.
attributes.additional_details: The law for a long time has failed animals, we now need to start punishing these crimes accordingly. There is an acknowledged link between animal cruelty and violence against other humans, another reason that classifying a breathing living creature as "property" is barbaric.

attributes.action: Intervene  NOW with the Government of Indonesia to  reprieve Lindsay SandIford
attributes.background: The severity of the sentence was greeted with shock because prosecutors had not recommended the death penalty for Sandiford. The ruling was also condemned by the British government and antiâdeath penalty campaigners. It's also contrary to International Law, which we should uphold and enforce!
attributes.additional_details: Guardian articles , 28 April 2016,and 14 June 2016. Wickipaedia entry "Linsay Sandiford. Numerous other press reports in all reputable newspapers and international media

attributes.action: Make Bromethalin rat poison illegal in the U.K. Because of the dangers to pets
attributes.background: On Friday the 14th of October 2016 I found my cat grubby and walking into things,she was a wild cat and was always outside.we noticed she was walking into things and her eyes looked weird, we realised she was blind. We brought her to the vet and they referred us to the hospital.
attributes.additional_details: On Friday the 14th of October 2016 I found my cat grubby and walking into things,she was a wild cat and was always outside.we noticed she was walking into things and her eyes looked weird, we realised she was blind. We brought her to the vet and they referred us to the hospital for her they said they would keep her over night, we got a call the next morning.she had been sick green stuff and she was much worse the vet said she was poisoned by a type of rat poison and we had to put her down.

attributes.action: Amend animal welfare act to ban the practice of giving away animals as prizes.
attributes.background:
Calling upon the ban of ALL animals given as prizes to any age not just under the age of 16. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 in England and Wales makes it an offence to give away an animal as a prize if the person can reasonably be believed to be under 16 and is not accompanied by an adult.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the case in Scotland, where under the Animal Health and Welfare (Scotland) Act 2006, it is an offence to offer or give an animal to another person as a prize (whatever their age), except where it is offered in a family context.

attributes.action: Stop parents who maliciously deny the other parent access to their children
attributes.background: There are many examples of one parent who stops the other parent from having access to their own children for no good reason other than their own gain and take no consideration of the best interests of their children as often the children will have a strong relationship with the alienated parent
attributes.additional_details: When this happens there can be a long wait for resolution through mediation and/or courts of months. Before any formal hearings take place, it should be illegal for parents to do this and revision of the children and families act is required to give police greater powers of discretion to enforce equal contact where malicious behaviour is proven. Currently there is no support for alienated parents in the interim period before formal proceedings. This must change and made criminal.

attributes.action: Create a benefit for bereaved parents.
attributes.background: Currently in the U.K. there is a pension and a one off payment of Â£2000 of your partner dies. Well what if your child dies? Benefits for bereaved parents would give them time to grieve after loss.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents should not be struggling to make ends meet and worrying about how to pay the mortgage after the death of a child. 
They should be given a minimum of 6 months paid leave if their child dies, to come to terms with their loss. This would create a better working environment in the long run and better mental health for the parent/s affected. Also aftercare counselling should be provided for them to aid them in their wellbeing.

attributes.action: Urge the Bank of England to stop using animal products in Â£5 bank notes
attributes.background: The Bank of England has confirmed that the polymer pellet from which the base substrate is made contains a trace of a substance known as tallow. Tallow is derived from animal fats (suet) and is a substance that is also widely used in the manufacture of candles and soap.
attributes.additional_details:
Bank notes must be made in an ethical manner, so that they can reasonably be used by the millions of British people who live their lives actively avoiding being complicit in the exploitation of animals or the cruel treatment of animals- including unknowing exposure to any products contaminated by using the flesh or fat or bones from animals, including those killed using the cruel Halal slaughter method.
It is wrong that bank notes contain any animal product or allergens.

attributes.action: Urge the NHS to back the 8-week blood sugar diet method to avoid T2 Diabetes.
attributes.background: Increasing numbers of people are recovering from type 2 diabetes without drugs using the nutrition based 8-week blood sugar diet method at a time when instances of limb amputations, blindness and other complications are rising dramatically.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference 1: "The 8-week blood sugar diet method" by Dr Michael Mosley and Prof. Roy Taylor

Reference 2: Colin Beattie MSP (successful use of this method)

Reference 3: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3404259/Eat-beat-diabetes-just-eight-weeks-s-life-changing-diet-help-avoid-reverse-Type-2-diabetes-best-s-tasty-way-health.html

attributes.action: Protect access to state funded benefits and services for humanitarian workers.
attributes.background: Humanitarian workers who serve oversea with registered charities are discriminated against and do not have the same access to publicly funded benefits and services that UK dwelling people do. Their service in the national interest means that they no longer meet presence based qualification criteria.
attributes.additional_details: In recognition of their contribution to the national interest certain categories of workers, like military personnel and public servants, have their access to benefits and service protected when living overseas in the line of duty. Thus they are treated by legislation as being physically present in the UK, even when overseas. This protection of rights to access state funded assistance or services, from discretionary or mandatory disqualification, should be extended to humanitarian workers.

attributes.action: Make government help fund Silverstone Circuit so they can keep hosting F1
attributes.background: Silverstone is the home of Formula One, & motor racing in general. The British Grand Prix NEEDS to be kept at this historic track to help sustain the future of the sport. It's bad enough we, the fans, are unable to watch all races live on free-to-air, so to lose this too would be devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/formula1/38526002

https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2017/jan/05/future-f1-british-grand-prix-silverstone-in-doubt-hosting-costs

http://www.skysports.com/f1/news/12433/10719351/silverstone-considering-terminating-british-gp-contract

attributes.action: Make adult adoption legal in the UK
attributes.background: Many people today do not live in traditional nuclear families; and many children form a stronger bond with a step-parent or relationship with someone of a similar nature as opposed to a biological parent.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems, for many reasons, children and their potential adopters don't get the opportunity to discuss and/or execute adoption until the child has reached legal adulthood; and by this point the UK government no longer views the said child as eligible for adoption.
The implications of this are social and legal issues that arise later in life surrounding the relationship between child and, for example, step-parent.
I believe the 2002 UK Adoption and Children Act is outdated for modern day Britain.

attributes.action: Impose mandatory custodial sentences for assaults on Emergency service personnel
attributes.background: To reduce assaults on emergency service personnel a strong deterrent must be in place. Anyone convicted of such an offence should receive a mandatory custodial prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
Emergency service personnel in this country work day in day out, 24 hours a day 365 days a year, putting themselves in life and death situations to help members of the public.

Far to often we see stories on the news of paramedics, police officers and fire fighters being subjected to countless assaults and sustaining injuries affecting their ability to work whilst also reducing the capacity of these services to continue to provide a full service to those who need it.

The only way to reduce this is to send a strong message that it WILL NOT be tolerated and to introduce a strong deterrent to anyone believing they can engage in such behaviour without serious consequences. As such anyone convicted of such a crime should be handed a mandatory custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Introduce Ombudsman for Future Generations & UN Sustainable Development Goals
attributes.background: The UK government agreed to 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals, including: environmental protection, reducing emissions, clean energy, responsible consumption & production. An Ombudsman to protect the future of humanity against climate change is needed. As is clear policy to enable accountability.
attributes.additional_details: The government must act fast to provide baseline statistics. There must be procedure in place so that those acting against climate change for future generations can be made accountable. An action plan and policy must be clear and transparent. Management of SDGs and climate action must not come under the umbrella of Dept. Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy, it requires its own leader and must be woven into all other departments as it affects all other departments.

attributes.action: Create an awareness campaign to highlight  the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background:
Type 1 diabetes is on the increase in the UK, the biggest increase is in children, especially those under the age of 5 years old.
Unfortunately many people are unaware of the symptoms which can lead to deadly results. A delay in diagnosis can be fatal, children are dying needlessly.
attributes.additional_details:
Type 1 diabetes is a condition which is completely mis-understood, it has nothing to do with lifestyle, which is a common misconception. It complicates even the most simplest of tasks. 
There has never been a campaign that educates parents and medical professionals in the symptoms of Type 1 diabetes. Once diagnosed, and with the correct treatment and support nothing is impossible. You only have to look at our Prime Minister. 
Education is the key.

attributes.action: Referendum on the renewal of the Trident nuclear submarine programme
attributes.background: We should be able to make the decision on whether or not the UK Government spends billions of pounds on the Trident nuclear missile programme, or if we would like it to be spent elsewhere within our economy as some sources estimate that renewal could be upwards of Â£200bn.

attributes.action: Make the taking of fish from all privately owned waters a criminal offence
attributes.background: Fishing is the most participated sport in the UK, however, the illegal removal of fish from privately owned lakes is having a devastating impact on the future of all angling, the cost of replacing stolen fish is crippling local clubs and associations lakes and must be stopped

attributes.action: Parliament to debate whether it is possible to make a success of leaving the EU.
attributes.background: The Government has repeatedly stated it is determined to "make a success" of Brexit. While 52% of eligible voters may have voted to leave the EU, mere determination to make a success out of Brexit is insufficient. The notion Brexit can be successful is not supported by evidence and must be debated.
attributes.additional_details: Potential consequences include the UK leaving the Single Market and the break-up of the UK (both contrary to pledges made in the Conservative Manifesto); a plunge in the value of sterling (which hit a 168-year low following the referendum); few trading partners (diplomats for India, Canada, the US & Australia have stated they prioritise the EU over the UK); the loss of sovereignty over Gilbratar (a red line for Spain in negotiations); no deal with the EU (the 18-month timeframe is unrealistic).

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all mainline train services to carry a defibrillator
attributes.background: It is not currently mandatory for mainline train services to carry defibrillators. Defibrillators save lives.

attributes.action: Auto British Citizenship for EU Citizens working here for more than 10 years.
attributes.background: Give automatic British Citizenship to EU Nationals living and working in the UK for more than 10 years that never committed a crime and never claimed benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The current process to obtain British Citizenship is outdated, too expensive and does not reward law abiding EU citizens that have been working in the UK for a long time and contributing to the wealth and cultural richness of the UK. 

EU Citizens should not need to pay for ESOL Tests if they been living here for so long and have other UK qualifications at Level 2 or above. 

Work and tax records should be checked by simply asking the applicant to provide their National Insurance Number.

attributes.action: Elizabeth Truss to use her powers of executive clemency in the cases of 500 IPPs
attributes.background:
prisoners serving  (IPP) were "languishing in jail". IPP sentences, abolished in 2012, were having a serious effect on prisoners' mental health.
More than 3,800 prisoners are serving indeterminate IPP sentences, designed to protect the public
attributes.additional_details:
Truss to resume prison officer talks
Of those, 500 should be let go, former Justice Secretary Michael Gove said, when he delivered the annual Longford lecture in memory of prison reformer Lord Longford.

Mr Gove said executive clemency should be granted to release prisoners who had served far longer than the tariff for their offence and had now - after multiple parole reviews - served even longer than the maximum determinate sentence for that offence.

attributes.action: Create awareness of Peritoneal Mesothelioma and support clinical trials for cure
attributes.background: The government must raise awareness of peritoneal mesothelioma so health professionals and the public are aware of the signs and symptoms of this rare, but increasing, disease, leading to earlier diagnosis and better prognosis for patients.they must also support clinical trials to help find a cure.
attributes.additional_details: My mum was diagnosed with peritoneal mesothelioma 2 yrs ago after 6 yrs of symptoms and numerous misdiagnoses. she was given 2 Weeks to live a yr ago but still fights on.Mums diagnosis came too late for her to have life lengthening surgery,and at every turn we are told there is nothing that can be done. Many Drs haven't even heard of the illness.No trials are ongoing for a cure because "drugs companies won't make enough money due to the relatively small number of people with the disease"

attributes.action: Redefine Children Act 1989 allow both biological mothers & fathers equal rights
attributes.background: Parental Responsibility (PR) as defined in the Children Act 1989 (CA 89) has caused so much misery and in extreme cases death of parents and children, there must be an equal 50/50 responsibilities and authorities in relation to the child and the childâs property for biological parents .

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for Group Strep B to be tested in every pregnancy
attributes.background: Group Strep B can be fatal to newborns and can be picked up during pregnancy. All it takes is a simple blood test (which are done in early stages anyway) or a swab. This needs to be made mandatory so it can be dealt with in the correct way during labour and afterbirth etc. Please help make it happen

attributes.action: Urge FIFA to overturn the England V Scotland Poppy Ban
attributes.background: FIFA want to stop players wearing Poppies at the game, as apparently it is a political statement?  How is honouring our Armed Forces doing this?  I feel the Government should urge FIFA to overturn this ban.

attributes.action: Scrap Tax on Savings Income altogether, NOT just the 1st Â£1000
attributes.background: As Interest rates on 'Savings Accounts' are at record lows currently, people are now struggling to live off their savings incomes, which the government taxes after the 1st Â£1000 income at 20%.
attributes.additional_details: The government can easily scrap this tax for savers, forever, in the next Budget, also, would save a lot of people having to complete the Self-Assessment to repay Savings Income above Â£1000.

attributes.action: Introduce a legal ratio of nurse to patient.
attributes.background: Something I have witnessed not only as a Healthcare Assistant but also as a student nurse is the increasing number of patients a Staff Nurse is being forced to care for. The government need to recognise this is wrong and jeopardising patient safety! Make the legal limit 1 Nurse: 8 Patients.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm a student nurse who is looking to work for the NHS once I qualify, however, this growing number of patients that Nurses are being made to look after TERRIFIES me! 
There needs to be a limit put in place to safeguard Nurses and patients. It isn't safe to have up to 12 patients to 1 Nurse. 
Avoidable mistakes are being made daily on wards due to low levels of staffing! 
Imagine it was your mother, father, nan or grandad who was admitted to hospital where the Nurse can't give them the best care

attributes.action: Change  'Assaulting a Police Officer' to Assaulting Emergency Services personnel
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted across the country leaving them with severe injurys that stop them from doing the amazing work they do. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Office has for many years.
attributes.additional_details: Across the news the past month, story's are arising of emergency services Personel being assaulted while carrying out the jobs. Ambulance staff that are there to treat and help people are being assaulted leaving them with serious injurys that stop them from working. The law should be changed to help combat the disgusting behaviour that is being seen across the country.

attributes.action: Rectify a disparity in MOD regulations over the use of Unit badges on memorials.
attributes.background: The three Services have their own rules for which names, Crests or Unit Badges can be used on private, family instigated memorials and/or their headstone, post mortem. The Royal Navy and Army state that any amount of service is acceptable, where as the RAF can require as much as 20 years service

attributes.action: FAIR TRADING-include the details of the leather source on the products labels.
attributes.background: Our campaign, aims to expose and end the cruelty within the leather industry. Consumer Rights Reg.from Unfair Trading 2008 /1277, Reg. 6 (consumer right to be protected from unfair trading, where it is likely to cause the consumer to take a transactional decision he would not have taken otherwise).
attributes.additional_details: large portion of the leather available on the world market is exported, under omitted information such as âleather from an animal farmed for meatâ. Some cultures, particularly Asian considers dogs and cats as âanimals farmed for meatâ. Our campaign aims to expose and end the cruelty within the leather industry. Based on existing legislation we therefore require that all retailers and traders include the details of the leather source on the products labels. We demand to know what it is we are buying

attributes.action: Include all domestic pets to the Road Traffic Act 1988
attributes.background: The Road Traffic Act 1988 states drivers must report incidents involving horse, cattle, ass, mule, sheep, pigs, goats and dogs. This was sufficient for these working animals at the time the legislation was set. In contemporary times, the government should add domestic companions to this list.
attributes.additional_details: A working animal, usually domesticated, is kept by humans and trained to perform tasks which tends to give them a special status within the law. Today there are a wide range of domestic animals kept in the UK who deserve to be included in the act. For example, today Cats are successfully used as companions for the sick and disabled in care programs. They have served in the agricultural sector and in the military over many years. The Act must be updated to reflect these modern relationships.

attributes.action: Protect us from speculative housing development. NPPF needs modification
attributes.background: Ramifications of councils not meeting 5yr land supply include reversal of planning refusals irrespective of poor infrastructure. Sprawling and unsustainable urbanisation is resulting! Councils need more time to prepare local plans to prevent speculative development which is a serious current issue
attributes.additional_details: Govât unambiguously demands "sustainable" development in NPPF; Gov't demands for decentralisation & localism are in disrepute. The crass 5yr rule needs modification to consider local circumstances; Councils must be able to manage the reality it creates. Evolving Local Plans leave communities open to unwelcome speculative & unsustainable development!  Inspectors should give more time to councils where land availability is an issue before overturning local decisions â we need protection from this

attributes.action: End unlawful detention without trial for political opponents in Bangladesh
attributes.background: Since 2009 the Bangladesh government have been purging members of opposition parties, in particular the Bangladesh National Party (BNP).  In August 2016 Hummam Chowdhury and Mir Ahmad Bin Quasem with links to the BNP, were picked arrested and continue to be unlawfully detained without trial.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the UK government to put diplomatic pressure on the Bangladesh government and Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to immediately end the detention of political opponents of the Awami League Party and release Mr Chowdhury and Mr Bin Quasem.  The UK government should do everything it can to prevent further human rights abuses in Bangladesh and should consider pressing for sanctions with the international community if this practice persists.

attributes.action: Stop the Boundary Commission splitting Great Grimsby into two constituencies
attributes.background: Parliamentary boundaries define the area where a person votes for their local MP â their parliamentary constituency. A boundary review examines these areas and makes proposals for a new set of boundaries which are fairer and more equal, while also trying to reflect GEOGRAPHIC FACTORS and LOCAL TIES.
attributes.additional_details: The Boundary Commissionâs proposal to cut our historic town completely down the middle therefore makes no sense, separating the famed docks in East Marsh Ward from the centrepiece Peopleâs Park in Park Ward and the River Freshney in Freshney Ward from the ancient village in Scartho Ward. The proposal is unfair, undemocratic and unacceptable and is based on an out-of-date version of the electoral register. Sign this petition and keep the town of Great Grimsby in one seat.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cages under 80x50cm for hamsters
attributes.background:
Thousands of hamsters are kept in cages not suitable. 
According to a pet shop "a cage sized 30X59cm is the biggest cage & is suitable to keep a hamster in as they don't grow much." Incorrect advice is being given to owners & millions of hamsters are living in cages that are not actually big enough
attributes.additional_details:
This leads to physical issues, chronic stress causing untamed behaviour & sadly, even worse.

The RSPCA's guideline is 80X50cm floor space as a minimum. There are thousands of cages smaller than this being sold every day as "permanent" homes for Syrian Hamsters by uneducated staff.

Cages sold as Large (30x59cm) are too small for permanent residence, the minimum recommended size for an adult Syrian should be 80x50cm. Lets be the voice for those that cant speak & improve the welfare of hamsters.

attributes.action: The Government should send a declaration of Secession to the EU immediately
attributes.background: Britain does not need a Trade Deal with the EU, in fact, it will be detrimental.  Art. 50 will lead us into years of negotiation with little to show for it on their terms.  A trade deal will keep also keep us tied to the EU.  We need to declare WTO rules and offset tariffs with savings.
attributes.additional_details: The EU will continue to argue for a Brexit on their terms when it should be on ours.  The UK voted to completely leave the EU and by following Art. 50, we shall be tied to them for years.  A simple declaration of secession will leave the EU with the option of treating the UK as any other 3rd State instead of trying to hang on to us.  Savings will offset any tariffs they choose to impose, or they can choose to work with us tariff free to mutual benefit and we can trade with the World immediately

attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt.
attributes.background: The budget for mental health trusts fell by 2% from 2013/14 to 2014/15. Also, in the year April 2016 the budget for mental health trusts was projected to rise by a dismal 0.3%. Jeremy Hunt is ruining our NHS, which was created after WW2 to assist people regardless of their socioeconomic background.
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned call upon parliament to hold a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt. Arguably, Jeremy Hunt is in breach of The National Health Service Act (S1) (1a). It states 'The Secretary of State must continue the promotion in England of a comprehensive health service designed to secure improvement in the physical and mental health of the people of England'. By cutting the budget of mental health trusts Jeremy Hunt is, potentially putting patients lives at risk; not promoting the NHS.

attributes.action: Drivers caught using a mobile phone whilst driving 6 penalty points. Â£1000 fine.
attributes.background: I have been an undertaker for many years. I have witnessed the aftermath and carnage whilst attending fatal crashes, where driver has been distracted by using mobile phone and lost control. The percentage of motorists using phones has risen!!! in the past 5 years. They are laughing at the law.
attributes.additional_details: I still remember attending a fatality where the driver had driven into back of lorry...his mobile phone still connected to the call.
